title: Senior Dynamics CE Developer
description:
*Are you the developer who thrives on solving complex challenges, fine-tuning every line of code, and pushing Dynamics 365 CE beyond its limits? Join Dustin’s Dynamics team to shape the future of Dynamics 365 in an international setup.*
*We are* 
 looking for someone who lives to code, thrives on technical challenges and loves diving deep into the guts of Dynamics 365, Azure integrations and custom business logic.
   

  

**This is what makes the position as Senior Dynamics 365 CE Developer unique**
* A senior role designed for developers who want full ownership of code and innovation.
* Take ownership of designing and delivering innovative technical solutions that drive business transformation.
* A collaborative environment where a "win as a team" attitude prevails, fostering growth and success collectively.


 You will be part of the Dynamics team, with current operations live in BNLX and an exciting project underway in the Nordics. We encourage a welcoming and collaborative environment, with a mix of personalities and an international team, ensuring everyone works together to achieve success.
   

  

*Read more about Dustin here*
**Your role & influence as Senior Dynamics 365 CE Developer**
*Responsibility* 
 : You will play a crucial role in designing, developing and implementing solutions within the Dynamics 365 CE platform to meet the business requirements. This role includes managing releases, coordinating connected ISVs, ensuring code quality, maintaining Dynamics environments, troubleshooting issues, and driving technical excellence.
   

  

*Collaboration* 
 : You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver seamless Dynamics 365 CE solutions and technical releases, ensuring high-quality outcomes.
   

  

 This role requires a strong understanding of Microsoft technologies, CRM development expertise, and the ability to analyse complex business requirements to propose efficient solutions.
   

  

**Core Activities**
* Write high-quality, high-performance and maintainable code, and ensuring smooth solution releases.
* Conducting design reviews, troubleshooting, and maintaining environment stability.
* Collaborating to align technical solutions with business requirements in line with industry best practices.


**Benefits of** 
**joining Dustin**
 We believe there's more to Dustin than just the benefits listed here. You'll fully understand this once you're with us.
   

  

 You can find more of our Swedish benefits below in the vacancy.
   

  

**This** 
**is what we imagine you bring**
 We envision you as a curious and driven individual who combines senior-level expertise in Dynamics 365 CE, .NET, C#, JavaScript/TypeScript, Power Platform, and Azure DevOps with excellent communication skills and a passion for collaboration and problem-solving.
   

  

**Additionally, It's Nice That You Have**
* Bachelor's degree level of working and thinking and 5 years’ or more experience of similar job.
* Experience with API integrations, Dual Write, and release pipelines.
* Strong technical skills in Azure services like Azure Functions, Logic Apps, and Service Bus.
* Proficiency with SQL Server and related database management tasks.


**What** 
**can you expect next?**
 To Ensure a Fair Recruitment Process Free From Unconscious Bias, We Handle Your Application Anonymously And Do Not Accept Cover Letters. Please Refrain From Sending One, So That The Selection Is Based Solely On Professional Competencies. We Expect The Following Steps In The Recruitment Process
   

  

* Telephone screening with Talent Acquisition Partner, Karishma Sindhu.
* First interview with Hiring Manager, Mirjam Stegeman and a colleague.
* Technical (Second) interview with future colleagues from the team.
* A possible final Interview with Director Application Management, Sara Wennerström.
* Professional References.


******Please note that for this specific job, we don´t provide any relocation or work permit sponsorship support.******
**About**
**Read more about how to become a** 
**Dustineer**
 For questions about the position, please contact the Talent Acquisition Partner, Karishma Sindhu via karishma.sindhu@dustin.com.

title: C, Golang Software Engineer working on dqlite, a Raft extension for SQLite
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring a software developer to focus on dqlite, our distributed SQLite database which uses our own Raft library for establishing consensus and replication. Dqlite is available as a pure C library or through a Go package that we also maintain, and we intend to provide bindings for Python and other languages.
   

  

 You will design and implement enhancements to the libraft, dqlite and go-dqlite components which we consume in MicroK8s, LXD and other projects. Work includes development in those pieces of software as well as responding to issues and user inquiries.
   

  

 This is an excellent opportunity for someone who wants to have a meaningful impact on modern computing technologies. Canonical offers a fast-paced team environment and a career full of learning and development opportunities.
   

  

***Location***
 : This is a remote position available in EMEA
   

  

 What you will focus on
   

  

* Design and implement features across dqlite
* Debug and fix issues encountered by your users
* Improve Jepsen tests, traditional HA database automated testing and stress tests
* Participate in our engineering process through code and architectural review
* Engage with the open source community and commercial partners


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Experience with distributed systems (preferably with Raft)
* Good C programming experience
* Solid understanding of asynchronous programming and concurrency patterns a plus
* Capacity to learn quickly about new systems and techniques
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future. If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**About Volvo Buses and the Global Bus Technology Team**  

Volvo Buses is a global leader in sustainable people transport solutions. By joining the Global Bus Technology Team, you’ll become part of a newly established, central analytics function dedicated to building a next-generation data and model framework. Our vision is to create an Integrated Bus Analytics Framework—a universe of interconnected models and data assets that describe every aspect of the bus, accessible to all and fueling the development of future generations of buses.

 **Your Mission**  

As a Data Scientist in this innovative central team, you will play a foundational role in building and evolving the Integrated Bus Analytics Framework from the ground up. You’ll support the Global Bus Technology Organization, by connecting data and insights from project office and product development to service market technology and customer quality experience. Your work will ensure that models are reliable, interpretable, and accessible for all relevant stakeholders, and you’ll design them to be modular and scalable so they can be built upon and interconnected.

  

Collaboration is key in this role. You’ll work closely with Volvo Group teams to hand over pilot models and support the development of user-facing interfaces, making sure data-driven insights reach end users across the organization. By driving a closed-loop approach, you’ll embed lessons learned throughout the bus’s lifetime, continuously improving products, services, and customer experience. Your contributions will help grow a universe of bus knowledge that accelerates the development of next-generation buses.

 **Key Responsibilities**  

In this role, you will develop and operationalize pilot models, ensuring they are robust, interpretable, and maintainable. You’ll partner with interface teams to integrate models into user-facing tools and platforms, facilitating seamless adoption and maximum business impact. Maintaining and documenting models will be part of your daily work, ensuring they remain relevant and effective as the framework evolves. You’ll also facilitate knowledge sharing and model accessibility within the Global Bus Technology Team, supporting a culture of continuous improvement and innovation. By connecting data and insights across all phases of the bus lifecycle, you’ll ensure feedback and lessons learned are systematically captured and used to drive future improvements.

**Qualifications**  

We’re looking for a passionate team player with a collaborative mindset and a drive to make a difference. If you fulfill most of the qualifications below, we encourage you to apply—even if you don’t meet every single requirement.

  

You bring a Master’s or PhD degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, and have experience in a Data Scientist role. You’re skilled in developing, operationalizing, maintaining, and interpreting advanced data analytics models, and you have strong programming abilities in Python, PySpark, and SQL. Experience with cloud platforms and data engineering tools such as Azure and Databricks is important, as is a clear understanding of the machine learning lifecycle from development to post-release.

  

Additional qualifications that will help you succeed include:  

* Proven experience with shipping ML models to production, including MLOps, CI/CD, Docker, and Kubernetes.
* Familiarity with tools and libraries such as PyTorch, spaCy, Joblib, PyDantic, Transformers, Vector Stores, and RAG.
* Grounded knowledge of model monitoring tools (MLFlow) and metrics (runtime/drift).
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, especially in cross-functional and cross-organizational settings.
* Experience in the automotive or transport sector is an advantage.
 **What We Offer**  

At Volvo Buses, you’ll have the opportunity to shape the future of sustainable transport and data-driven innovation. You’ll be part of a newly established, central team with a unique mandate to serve the entire Global Bus Technology organization, working in a dynamic, collaborative, and visionary environment. You’ll have access to advanced technology and the chance to build the Integrated Bus Analytics Framework, all while growing professionally in a global organization.

 **Ready for the next move?**  

If you want to make a real impact in your career, the transportation business is where you want to be. We look forward to meeting you. If you have any questions about the position, please contact Hiring Manager Therese Dahlström at therese.dahlstrom@volvo.com  

We look forward to receiving your application! The final date to apply is the 12th of December, 2025 but don’t wait with your application as we will conduct interviews in parallel.

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.

  

At **Volvo Buses** you join one of the world’s leading providers of sustainable people transport solutions. What we do affects millions of people around the world: passengers, drivers, customers; in fact, entire cities and countries. This job gives you the opportunity to work with the future of people transportation and infrastructure. We have a strong culture of working together to help each other, sharing knowledge and experience. Together, we shape the world we want to live in.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Senior Data Management Specialist to Data & Analytics team within Cash Management, CIB \u007C SEB, Stockholm
description:
**About the role**
In this role, you will be part of the team responsible for managing and developing SEB’s Account & Payments data. You will take an active role in shaping how data is modelled, governed, and maintained — ensuring high data quality and compliance across our products and systems.
You’ll work closely with data owners, stewards, architects, analysts, and business stakeholders to ensure that our data is structured, understood, and usable for everything from regulatory reporting to customer insights and product innovation.
Our data and analytics solutions are built on **Google Cloud Platform (GCP)**.
### **Key responsibilities**

* Take ownership of the Account & Payments data domain and drive initiatives related to data modelling, governance, and quality.
* Define, document, and maintain conceptual and logical data models that describe our financial products and processes, using EA Sparx.
* Support implementation of data management practices, including metadata management, business glossaries, and data lineage.
* Coordinate across teams to ensure alignment between business, data, and technical perspectives.
* Drive continuous improvement of our data governance and data quality processes in collaboration with the central data office.
* Contribute to SEB’s data strategy by identifying opportunities to improve data reusability, consistency, and compliance.
* Communicate and translate complex data concepts to business stakeholders in a clear and engaging way.

 **Who we are looking for**
We are looking for a senior professional with strong experience in **data management within banking or financial services**. You enjoy both coordinating across stakeholders and diving deep into the details when needed.  

You may have held roles such as Data Management Officer, Data Steward, Information Modeler, Data Owner, or Information Architect — what matters most is your broad understanding of data management and your ability to turn knowledge into action.### **Your background and skills:**

* 5–8 years of experience within data management, preferably in the banking sector.
* Solid understanding of data modelling (conceptual, logical), data governance, and data quality management.
* Experience working with information models, metadata, or business glossaries.
* Familiarity with modelling tools and cloud-based data platforms such as **GCP**.
* Ability to navigate regulatory and compliance aspects related to data.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, combined with excellent communication abilities.
* Fluent in English; Swedish is a plus.

**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.  

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 7 January 2026. If you have questions about the position, please contact Jonatan Elnäs at jonatan.elnas@seb.se. We will not process applications via email.
Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for instance identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks.  

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** on our Career website.  

SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, which is why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
company_description: More than 15.000 people work at SEB. Working in SEB means being part of an exciting journey, driven by digital transformation

title: Marketing Communication Manager, Sweden
description:
Who we are


At Sonova, we envision a world where everyone can enjoy the delight of hearing. This vision inspires us and fuels our commitment to developing innovative solutions that improve hearing health and human connection - from personal audio devices and wireless communication systems to hearing aids and cochlear implants. We're dedicated to providing outstanding customer experiences through our global audiological care services, ensuring that everyone has the opportunity to engage fully with the world around them.


Guided by a culture of continuous improvement that fosters resilience and self-motivation, our team is united by a shared commitment to excellence and a deep sense of pride in our work, each of us playing a vital role in creating meaningful change,


Here you’ll find a diverse range of opportunities that span both consumer and medical solutions and the freedom to shape your career while making an impact on the lives of others. Join us in our mission to create a more connected world, where every voice is heard and every story matters.


Solna, Sweden
Marketing Communication Manager, Sweden


Make a tangible difference with us at Sonova. Together with your collegues you will be the driving force behind our marketing in Sweden for our life-changing hearing solutions. In this generalist role you will belong to a Nordic marketing team in our B2B organisation and be in lead of processes and activities for the Swedish market, but you will also support your colleagues in the other Nordic countries when needed due to ongoing projects/campaigns/launches.  



What you’ll do
* Transform customer insights into targeted marketing programs for Sweden, aligned with Nordic strategy and Sales strategy.
* Co-own the Swedish marketing plan and budget; prioritize investments to maximize ROI and real-world impact.
* Create and tailor local content across channels (web, landing pages, testimonials, social, newsletters) that stays true to brand guidelines.
* Plan and execute campaigns to reach defined audiences; lead product launches in close collaboration with Sales.
* Generate compelling content to raise consumer awareness and support business customers.
* Co-plan and run communications around exhibitions, trade fairs, seminars, and training events; handle invites, venues, logistics, and follow-up.
* Lead launches with Sales, including customer events and external exhibitions; own the associated marketing materials.
* Localize HQ materials, ensuring timely proofreading/translation and availability for campaigns.
* Keep marketing materials and giveaways stocked for launches, events, and visits.
* Plan and host webinars with Sales or external speakers; manage invites, hosting, recording, and publishing.
* Visit customers to understand needs and tailor marketing assets accordingly.
* Lead testimonial programs with consumers and customers; coordinate video and photo material for use across channels.
* Stay engaged in recurring marketing–sales forums; act on decisions and opportunities.
* Bring market feedback into business development and drive continuous improvements; run A/B tests where feasible.
* Be proactive about process improvements; support other functions when needed; keep trainings up to date.
* Foster an inclusive, solution-oriented culture and stay aligned with Sonova’s values and leadership principles.

  



To be successful in this role you will need to bring some experiences and skills with you, but a fundamental part will also be your mindset and curiosity to do new things or new ways.  


* **Education and experience:** University degree in marketing or equivalent; experience from working in broad marketing role with hands-on data analysis, ROI thinking, and stakeholder/project management.
	+ Experience from working at a marketing agency is beneficial; previous Nordic exposure is a bonus.
* **Skills and style:** A team player with strong networking and communication skills; comfortable gathering input from multiple stakeholders; self-led, curious, and adaptable; pragmatic and solution-oriented; organized and target-driven.
* **Marketing know-how:** Go-to-market strategy, product positioning, value proposition development, case studies/testimonials, webinar/event marketing, audience-centric communication (B2B and B2C), basic ROI analysis and social media management (B2B and B2C).
	+ Customer journey thinking, AI-enhanced marketing/automation and design skills are a plus.
* **Tools and languages:** Fluency in Swedish and a professional level of English. If you also know some Finnish at professional level this is great. Your are proficient with Adobe Creative Cloud and MS Office.
	+ Familiarity with SAP, Canva, Salesforce/Marketing Cloud is helpful.
* **Collaboration and travel:** Comfortable working in a Nordic, matrix environment; able to collaborate with a HQ/Group function which sets directives and different stakeholders in your area of responsibility.


Why Sonova
* Purpose-driven products that improve people’s lives and reconnect them through better hearing.
* A close-knit Nordic team with opportunities to influence across Sweden and the Nordics, plus collaboration with HQ and Sales.
* Broad marketing exposure across channels in a global company, with room to grow.
* Flexible, inclusive culture that supports development and a healthy work-life balance.
* This role offers hybrid work possibilties where you will be asked to spend min 50 % of your time at our dog friendly office in Solna Business Park. We offer health allowance and pension contributions at market level.


How to apply

Send in your application via our dedicated recruitment system. Share your resume and a brief note on a campaign you’re proud of incl. your direct resp and contributions + things you considered/managed to get it in place, plus what you would be looking for in this position with us.

Deadline to apply: We will review applications as they come in.  


*We look forward to hearing from you!*  


*Interested in seeing more about us and what our products do? Feel free to visit our webpages:*
* *About us as company:* *This is Sonova | Sonova International*
* *About some of our products:* *Can Spheric Speech Clarity support how we think in noise? | Audiology Blog* *&* *Hearing Stories - röster från oss med hörselnedsättning | Phonak*
Sonova is an equal opportunity employer.


We team up. We grow talent. We collaborate with people of diverse backgrounds to win with the best team in the market place. We guarantee every person equal treatment in regard to employment and opportunity for employment, regardless of a candidate’s ethnic or national origin, religion, sexual orientation or marital status, gender, genetic identity, age, disability or any other legally protected status.

title: Data Architect
description:
**About Hubexo:**


We provide data, insights, and software solutions to the global construction industry. We specialise in project information, eTendering, product information, market intelligence, and specification. We help the world build better by delivering unrivalled insights and technology that shape places where people live, work and play.

**Your Role**


As a Data Architect within the Content Tech Tribe, your primary purpose is to define and govern the data architecture that powers Hubexo’s global content lifecycle. You will transform our project data into a well-defined, consistent, and accessible strategic asset, creating the foundational blueprint for the new event-driven collaborative system and other services built by the tribe.


This role is pivotal in shaping how Hubexo leverages data. You will lead the design of conceptual, logical, and physical data models that define the data contracts for our new systems, guiding both API developers and data migration strategies to ensure the integrity and quality of our data ecosystem.

**This is what you'll be doing**

* Design, develop, and govern the global data model for our content, ensuring it is scalable, consistent, and performant.
* Lead data migration and mapping initiatives, ensuring a seamless and accurate transition of data from legacy systems.
* Create and enforce standards for data attributes and metadata, building a comprehensive data dictionary as a single source of truth.
* Establish frameworks for data quality, data governance, and data lineage tracking to ensure data provenance and trust.
* Architect data structures that enable advanced analytics, AI, and machine learning initiatives.
* Collaborate with Solution Architects and API development teams to define robust data contracts and schemas for our GraphQL and REST APIs.
* Implement data governance and security policies in partnership with security teams to ensure compliance with regulations like GDPR.

**Requirements**

**Your Core Competencies**

* **8+ years of experience in data architecture**, with extensive conceptual, logical, and physical data modeling for large-scale, complex systems
* Proven experience designing **high-throughput, low-latency** data ingestion and processing pipelines (ETL/ELT) in a **cloud-native environment**
* Deep practical experience with **core cloud data services** (AWS S3, Glue, Redshift, Kinesis; or equivalent services in Azure/GCP)
* Strong proficiency in defining **data contracts and schemas** for APIs (REST, GraphQL) and **event-driven architectures**
* Expertise in building and maintaining **data governance frameworks**, including data quality, metadata management, lineage tracking, and data security
* Demonstrated experience leading **data migration** from legacy platforms to modern, cloud-native data models
* Excellent ability to **explain complex technical concepts** and collaborate effectively with engineering, solution architects, and product teams
* Strong capability to **break down large-scale global systems** into structured, manageable architectural components
* English proficiency at **C1 level**

**Your Additional Qualifications**

* Experience designing data models to support **AI/ML and advanced analytics** initiatives
* Hands-on experience with **modern data warehousing technologies** (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery) or data modeling tools (Erwin, Sparx EA)
* Familiarity with **data ingestion from diverse sources**, including web scraping technologies
* Experience working in **agile environments**, ideally within a tribe/squad model
* Strong planning and cross-team coordination skills, with the ability to engage stakeholders at all levels
* Certifications in **Data Architecture** or **Data Modeling** are a plus
* Curiosity, ownership, and a passion for building high-impact, scalable data systems

**Benefits**

**Why Hubexo**


We’re not here to coast - we’re here to challenge, grow, and build better. For our people and for our customers. That means we’ll expect a lot from you: ownership, precision, and a drive to lead by example. In return, you’ll get the space to dream big, take smart risks, and be seen, heard, and valued.

**Ready to build your future?**


At Hubexo, we are united by our vision to empower the construction industry with our innovative insights and technology. We like to dream big and thrive together. If you're ready to be part of one global team that is helping to shape the future of construction and build a better world, join us!

title: Senior Test Lead & Tester
description:
Role description
  
We are looking for a Senior Test Lead to secure the quality of large-scale, cloud-based data and rule-processing systems used to detect financial irregularities. In this role, you will lead test strategy and planning, validate complex data pipelines, and ensure the accuracy and reliability of rule engines in a modern GCP environment. You will work closely with engineering, analytics and architecture teams to align QA practices with business and regulatory requirements, and apply strong technical testing skills in automation, exploratory testing and data validation.
  
Responsibilities
  
Define, lead and continuously improve test strategies for data-driven, cloud-based systems.
  
Plan, coordinate and execute test activities across data pipelines, rule engines and integrations.
  
Design and implement automated tests using Python, Java and SQL for data validation and functional/regression testing.
  
Conduct ETL testing, including validation of data transformations, data quality and data lineage across complex environments.
  
Validate behaviour and correctness of rule-based engines (e.g. decision tables and similar logic frameworks).
  
Work with GCP services (such as BigQuery, Bigtable and Composer) to support test design, execution and monitoring.
  
Collaborate with engineering, analytics and architecture teams to ensure QA is integrated throughout the delivery lifecycle.
  
Connect QA activities to business and regulatory needs, with a clear focus on compliance, risk and traceability.
  
Perform exploratory testing on data-driven features and services to identify defects and edge cases.
  
Produce clear test documentation, including test plans, test cases, test reports and defect descriptions.
  
Mentor team members in quality practices and contribute to building a strong QA culture.
  
  

Requirements
  
8–10+ years of experience testing data-driven systems or working in senior enterprise QA roles.
  
Strong skills in Python, Java and SQL for automated testing and data validation.
  
Hands-on experience with Google Cloud Platform services such as BigQuery, Bigtable and Composer.
  
Familiarity with ETL testing, data modelling and validation of data lineage in complex environments.
  
Understanding of rule-based engines such as decision tables or similar logic frameworks.
  
Strong system-thinking with the ability to link QA work to business objectives and compliance requirements.
  
Excellent communication and documentation skills, and experience working in agile, collaborative teams.
  
B.Sc., M.Sc. or Ph.D. in a relevant field.
  
Experience working with complex software systems in an enterprise environment.
  
Relevant certifications such as ISTQB (Foundation/Agile/Automation), Google Cloud certifications or REQB – or a strong willingness to obtain them.
  
  

Meriting
  
Experience from the banking or financial sector, particularly within regulatory or risk-related systems.
  
Experience working in highly regulated environments with strong audit and traceability requirements.
  
Background in test leadership roles where you have driven quality improvements across teams or programs.
  
  

Start / Duration
  
**Start:** 2026-02-02
  
**Duration:** Until 2027-01-29
  
  

Location
  
**Location:** Stockholm
  
  

About Rasulson Consulting
  
Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm within the IT sector. We partner with established technology companies as well as innovative startups to offer attractive career opportunities for professionals looking to grow within digital development and IT. With our strong technical expertise and extensive network, we effectively match the right consultant with the right assignment. At Rasulson Consulting, you will receive personalized guidance, ongoing feedback, and the opportunity to take the next step in your career.

Hantera in- och utcheckning av gäster, betalningar och kassahantering, bokningar, besvara telefonsamtal och e-post, administrativa uppgifter, upprätthålla brand- och säkerhetsrutiner under natten.
  
Tjänsten innebär nattskift- och helgarbete.

* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och fatta snabba beslut

title: DevSecOps engineer to API Governance team \u007C SEB, Solna
description:
Are you passionate about new technology and making a difference? Join API Governance team!  

  

SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. **About the role:**
Join a team of developers who are shaping a secure and reliable API platform at scale. You’ll take ownership of the API Gateway, ensuring it evolves with the latest upgrades and security standards. You’ll get hands-on with Kubernetes and OpenShift, improve and run services on GCP, and build modern infrastructure with Terraform. It’s a chance to work with cutting-edge tech, solve real challenges, and make a direct impact on how our business runs.  


### **Your responsibilities will include:**

* Looking after our API Gateway, keeping it secure, up to date, and running smoothly.
* Building and automating cloud infrastructure using Terraform (we love clean, repeatable deployments).
* Deploying, monitoring, and tuning workloads across Kubernetes and OpenShift.
* Running and improving services across our cloud environments (GCP, but also OpenShift/Kubernetes and other cloud tooling).
* Creating tools and small services that make our operations easier and smarter.
* Ensuring security, compliance, and good governance are naturally built into everything we do.
* Enhancing our observability using Splunk, cloud logging/monitoring, Prometheus, and similar tools.

### **What helps you thrive here:**

* You’re comfortable working in at least one modern programming language. We use Go, but Java, Python, C#, and others are just as welcome.
* You have experience with API Gateway configuration, upgrades, and security.
* You know your way around Terraform and infrastructure-as-code workflows.
* You’ve worked with Kubernetes and/or OpenShift.
* You understand cloud platforms such as GCP, AWS, or Azure.
* Linux troubleshooting feels natural to you.
* You’ve used observability tools like Splunk, Prometheus, Grafana, or ELK.
* Most importantly, you’re approachable, collaborative, and someone who makes the team better, not just the tech.

### **What we offer:**

* Extensive training and learning opportunities.
* Friendly and welcoming culture.
* Innovative company in forefront of technology.
* Opportunities to help transform an industry.
* Mobility within a large global company.
* Agile and modern ways of working.
* Empowering environment.
* Deliver world-class service to customers.

**Ready for your next challenge?**
It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from. **Ready to join?**
Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than the **2025-12-15**. If you have questions about the position, please contact the Team Manager Pär Steen via par.steen@seb.se.

title: Finance Accountant Consultant
description:
**About us**  

Mavenoid is the Intelligent Support Platform for products and devices. Our purpose-built technology delivers best-in-class customer support with intelligent troubleshooting and personalized remote support. Our product provides manufacturers and sellers genius-level customer support while reducing costs.  

Having raised our Series B, we’re in an exciting phase of growth but are still small enough for each new person to have a big impact on the company as a whole. We were founded in Stockholm, Sweden, but now operate globally as a remote-first company, with team members located across Sweden, the United Kingdom, the United States, and more. **The role**  

We’re looking for an experienced Financial Accountant Consultant to support the financial operations of our global B2B SaaS business. Reporting to the VP of Finance, you’ll manage multi-entity accounting, payroll, billing, and month-end close while ensuring accurate reporting and strong internal controls.  

  

This role is fully remote from the **UK or Sweden** and requires someone who is detail-oriented, proactive, and comfortable working across multiple countries, systems, and stakeholders.
### **In your first month, you will**

* Get up to speed on Mavenoid’s financial processes, tools, and entity structure
* Take ownership of recurring invoicing and monthly payroll coordination
* Take ownership of managing external bookkeepers and reviewing their outputs

### **In your first three months, you will**

* Lead month-end close activities across entities, including reconciliations and reporting
* Take full ownership of revenue schedules, deferred revenue, and credit control
* Establish consistent workflows with Sales/CS, payroll providers, and external accountants
* Run consolidated monthly management accounts independently
* Improve internal financial controls, documentation, and cross-functional processes
* Support audit preparation and ongoing regulatory compliance across regions

### **Responsibilities**

* Support monthly payroll across Sweden, the US, and the UK, ensuring accurate inputs and compliance
* Oversee SaaS invoicing, billing operations, credit control, and adherence to contract terms
* Maintain schedules for accrued and deferred revenue File UK VAT returns and US Sales Tax returns, including multi-state registrations
* Review and approve sales orders, partnering with Sales and Customer Success to ensure correct billing
* Coordinate and manage external bookkeepers
* Lead month-end close activities, including bank and balance sheet reconciliations and variance analyses
* Oversee creditor payment cycles, approvals, and bank payment processes
* Maintain strong internal financial controls and documentation
* Assist with audit preparation, schedules, and compliance
* Support VP Finance on financial analysis, process improvements, and system enhancements

### **Qualifications**

* Qualified accountant (e.g., ACA, ACCA, CPA) or equivalent
* Experience in an accounting role supporting a B2B SaaS or subscription-based business, ideally in a start-up environment
* Strong understanding of revenue processes, billing, VAT (UK), Sales Tax (US), multi-entity consolidation, and multi-state tax registrations
* Experience managing accounting activities across multiple countries
* Familiarity with cloud-based ERP systems, ideally NetSuite
* Excellent communication skills, strong attention to detail, and the ability to work independently in a remote environment

**Our Core Values** **Win as a Team** - Teams are not just extensions of leaders, but are instead a composite of individuals, each with their own strengths. We need to work together in order to scale. And, it’s more fun this way! **Teach & Be Taught** - As a company, we believe that there is always a way to improve how you work, and therefore it is important to be consistently open to learning. Also, in a fast-growing company, roles & contexts shift, and it is important to be able to adjust. Teaching others is the flip side of that – it's a great way to build deeper understanding of the topics you teach, and also an important tool to scale the organization as you step into new roles and responsibilities. **Cut out the B.S.** - Get to the bottom of the issue and surface the information needed to make good decisions. **Pick up the Pace** - As a startup, our structural advantage is speed, but only if we act with urgency. Don’t leave for tomorrow what you can do today. **Eyes on the Ball -** Don’t get distracted from what is most important, right now. In a startup, there are a million different things that you can do in any situation, and it’s necessary to have a consistent focus over time on the things that have the highest impact.

title: Solution Expert - Machine Data Connectivity
description:
Job Title: Solution Expert - Machine Data Connectivity
Job Requisition: R0086180
No. of Vacancies: 1
Location: Pune
Full time /Part Time: Full time
Regular /Temporary: Regular  

SANDVIK COROMANT is the world’s leading supplier of tools, tooling solutions and know-how to the metalworking industry. With extensive investments in research and development we create unique innovations and set new productivity standards together with our customers. These include the world's major automotive, aerospace and energy industries. Sandvik Coromant has 8,000 employees and is represented in 130 countries. We are part of the business area Sandvik Machining Solutions within the global industrial group Sandvik.
At Sandvik Coromant, we are driven by a passion for excellence in everything we do. Our belief is that sustainable success is a team effort and with our profound knowledge of metal cutting and insight into the varying challenges of different industries, we strive to develop innovative solutions in collaboration with our customers, to meet both current and future demands.
We are seeking for people who are passionate in their work and possess the drive to excel to join us.  

Purpose: This role is crucial with global footprint in ensuring seamless connectivity between a variety of machines located in different production units globally and our digital platform, facilitating the collection, transfer, and integration of data for real-time analysis and decision-making. The ideal candidate will have strong technical expertise in industrial automation, IoT (Internet of Things), especially machine data connectivity, along with a passion for improving machine performance. As a Machine Data Connectivity (MDC) Expert, you will work with product owner and will be responsible for critical aspects of digital platform. You will own and drive the best practices with other MDC expert in a team to connect different machines through sensors/communication protocols (like OPCUA, MQTT, etc.) to a digital platform, enabling data integrity and facilitating real-time insights.  

Main Responsibilities:
This role is crucial with global footprint in ensuring seamless connectivity between a variety of machines located in different production units globally and our digital platform, facilitating the collection, transfer, and integration of data for real-time analysis and decision-making. The ideal candidate will have strong technical expertise in industrial automation, IoT (Internet of Things), especially machine data connectivity, along with a passion for improving machine performance. As a Machine Data Connectivity (MDC) Expert, you will work with product owner and will be responsible for critical aspects of digital platform. You will own and drive the best practices with other MDC expert in a team to connect different machines through sensors/communication protocols (like OPCUA, MQTT, etc.) to a digital platform, enabling data integrity and facilitating real-time insights.  

 Key Competencies:  

Machine Connectivity:* Establish and maintain reliable data connections between various industrial machines and the company’s digital platform
* Implement and troubleshoot connectivity solutions for different machine types, including PLCs, sensors, SCADA systems, and other industrial equipment
* Remote and on-site troubleshooting support for Ethernet, Modbus, and industrial networks.

Data Integration and Management:* Develop, test, and deploy data protocols, interfaces, and APIs to ensure smooth communication between machines and backend systems
* Collaborate with data engineers and other IT teams to integrate machine-generated data into digital platforms and cloud services

IoT and Industry 4.0 Implementation:* Leverage IoT protocols (such as MQTT, OPC-UA, Modbus, etc.) to ensure efficient and scalable connectivity
* Participate in the deployment of Industry 4.0 technologies to enhance machine-to-machine communication and real-time data collection

Troubleshooting and Optimization:* Diagnose and resolve connectivity issues related to industrial equipment and systems
* Work closely with maintenance teams to improve machine uptime and optimize data transfer performance

Data Security & Compliance:* Ensure data transmission is secure and implement best practices for data encryption and cybersecurity
* Adhere to industry standards and regulatory requirements for data integrity and privacy

Collaboration & Documentation:* Work with cross-functional teams, including engineering, IT, and operations, to understand business needs and provide solutions
* Document machine connectivity configurations, protocols, and system setups for future reference and troubleshooting

Continuous Improvement:* Stay up to date with emerging technologies and trends related to industrial data connectivity
* Propose new approaches to enhance the digital transformation of machinery and improve the overall connectivity infrastructure

Your Profile:* Proven experience (8+ years) in machine connectivity, industrial automation, IoT, or related fields
* Hands-on experience with connectivity protocols (e.g., Modbus, OPC-UA, MQTT, RESTful APIs), protocol converters/gateways
* Familiarity with industrial machinery and systems (PLC, SCADA, DCS, sensors, etc.)
* Hands on experience in computer networks, networking and TCP/IP
* Experience in working with cloud platforms and data integration tools (e.g., Azure)
* Ability to drive the machine data connectivity independently in global manufacturing setup by collaborating with different production units globally
* Ability to communicate effectively in English (writing, speaking) with different global stakeholders as appropriate to capture requirements, resolve issues and document
* Knowledge of networking programming
* Knowledge in Docker, Kubernetes on Azure (ACR) or other cloud services is a plus
* Knowledge in cyber security is a plus
* Knowledge of tools like Jenkins, Jira is a plus
* Knowledge of SQL Server, Redis, NoSQL, DB2 would be a plus
* Time Management - Managing one's own time and the time of others.
* Active Listening -Giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate.

Benefits:  

Sandvik offers a competitive total compensation package including comprehensive benefits. In addition, we provide opportunities for professional competence development and training, as well as opportunities for career advancement.  

How to apply:
You may upload your updated profile in Workday against JR Number R0086180 through your login, no later than 05 January 2026  

Or  

Please send your application by registering on our site www.sandvik.com/career and uploading your CV against the JR Number R0086180 by 05 January 2026

title: Sales Executive
description:
We’re Redeploy. A tech consultancy built for people who want to grow, make a difference and have a good time doing it.
  
We design, build, scale and maintain modern solutions across Cloud, Data and AI, helping ambitious companies across the Nordics transform how they work with technology. As a trusted partner to Microsoft, AWS and Databricks, we deliver platforms that are built for impact and built to last.
  
What sets us apart is the way we work. Curiosity runs deep here, as does the drive to keep learning and sharing. You’ll join a team that values ownership, collaboration and high technical standards, and where people genuinely care about doing things well. For our clients. And for each other.
  
What you’ll do
  
**As a Sales Executive at Redeploy, you’ll have a clear focus:** bring in business that makes a difference - to our clients and to us. You’ll take full ownership of the sales process, from identifying new opportunities to closing deals, and you’ll do it in close collaboration with delivery leads, solution architects and domain experts.
  
We work closely with strategic partners like Microsoft, AWS and Databricks, and that shows in the solutions we deliver.
  
You’ll be selling both professional services and long-term managed services -with cloud, data and AI at the core.
  
  

**Your main responsibilities:**  

* Drive new business with SME, mid-sized and enterprise clients across the Nordics
* Manage the entire sales process – from prospecting to signed agreement
* Build and maintain a strong pipeline, using Cinode to track and prioritise opportunities
* Collaborate closely with technical and delivery teams to shape offers and proposals
* Navigate multiple stakeholders on the client side – commercial, technical and operational
* Stay involved post-sale to ensure smooth handover and long-term client satisfaction
* Represent Redeploy in meetings, events and briefings – both remote and on-site


What you’ll grow into
  
You’re joining us at a pretty exciting time. We’re in a strong growth phase with high ambitions, not just in terms of numbers, but in how we grow as a team and shape the way we go to market. You’ll help define how we build client value and develop our partnerships with Microsoft, AWS and Databricks.
  
This role gives you real ownership and the chance to make a clear impact, both on Redeploy and on the digital journeys of some of Sweden’s most forward-leaning companies. You’ll drive your own pipeline, grow business directly and through partners, and be rewarded through a competitive commission structure that recognizes strong performance.
  
Who we’re looking for
  
You’ve sold high-tech solutions before, maybe at a consultancy, SaaS company or product-focused tech firm. You’re structured, driven and easy to trust. You ask good questions, and you listen just as well. You take ownership of your work, but know how to lean on others to get the best outcome.
  
We believe the best deals come from trust and teamwork - across sales, tech and delivery. That’s why we’re looking for someone who thrives on challenge, values genuine collaboration, and is serious about delivering real results. You don’t just want to win deals, you want to make sure what we deliver actually works. You’re welcome to join us from either Stockholm or Gothenburg. We’re especially excited to grow our footprint in Gothenburg, so being based there or open to relocating is a big advantage.
  
What experiences you bring
  
* 5+ years of B2B sales experience within consulting, SaaS or tech
* A strong track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets in the Swedish market
* Experience selling complex, high-tech solutions to multi-stakeholder buying groups
* Comfortable managing multi-stakeholder sales cycles, from prospecting to closing
* Fluent in Swedish (native level) and English – both spoken and written
* Open to hybrid work and in-person meetings with clients when needed


Curious to learn more before applying? Have a look around our career site to explore our culture, people and way of working. And if you have any questions, feel free to reach out to our Talent Acquisition Manager, Francisca Andersson

title: Fullstack Engineer
description:
Role description
  
We are looking for a Fullstack Developer with strong modern engineering skills to build and operate digital products and microservices in a domain-driven environment. In this role, you will work across both backend services and user-facing applications, creating scalable, secure and observable solutions. You will collaborate closely with domain experts and product teams to translate business workflows into reliable technical implementations, using solid engineering practices such as automated testing, CI/CD, clear documentation and a DevSecOps mindset.
  
Responsibilities
  
Design, develop and maintain fullstack solutions using modern frontend frameworks and backend technologies.
  
Build and operate microservices and APIs that support digital products and domain-driven workflows.
  
Develop user-facing applications (e.g. React/Vue/Angular) integrated with backend services (e.g. Java/Kotlin/Node.js).
  
Ensure services are secure, scalable, testable and observable, with appropriate logging and monitoring.
  
Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines, including build, test and deployment automation.
  
Work with containerization (Docker) and orchestration (Kubernetes) for deployment and runtime operations.
  
Collaborate with domain experts, product managers and other developers to refine requirements and solution designs.
  
Produce clear technical documentation for services, APIs and system components.
  
Contribute to continuous improvement of engineering practices, coding standards and team ways of working.
  
  

Requirements
  
Experience working with modern fullstack frameworks (e.g. React, Vue or Angular together with Java, Kotlin or Node.js).
  
Strong understanding of microservices, API design and distributed systems.
  
Hands-on experience with CI/CD practices and tools.
  
Practical experience with Docker and Kubernetes.
  
Familiarity with at least one major cloud platform.
  
Understanding of observability and monitoring concepts (logging, metrics, tracing).
  
Awareness of security best practices and a DevSecOps mindset.
  
Comfortable working in a collaborative, product-oriented environment.
  
Strong communication skills and the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
  
  

Meriting
  
Experience working in domain-driven design (DDD) environments.
  
Experience with security-by-design and hardening of cloud-native services.
  
Experience operating production-grade systems with high availability requirements.
  
Experience contributing to or defining engineering guidelines and best practices.
  
  

Start / Duration
  
**Start:** 2026-01-06
  
**Duration:** Until 2027-01-07
  
  

Location
  
**Location:** Stockholm (hybrid, 2–3 days/week onsite)
  
  

About Rasulson Consulting
  
Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm within the IT sector. We partner with established technology companies as well as innovative startups to offer attractive career opportunities for professionals looking to grow within digital development and IT. With our strong technical expertise and extensive network, we effectively match the right consultant with the right assignment. At Rasulson Consulting, you will receive personalized guidance, ongoing feedback, and the opportunity to take the next step in your career.

title: Information Security Officer - Styrning & Tredjepartsrisk
description:
Vill du arbeta i en modern organisation där informationssäkerhet är en strategisk fråga och där du får möjlighet att påverka på riktigt? Vi söker dig som brinner för att omsätta komplexa krav till praktiska, användbara lösningar och som motiveras av att stärka säkerhetsnivån både internt och hos våra leverantörer.


Som Information Security Officer spelar du en central roll i att vidareutveckla Avanzas säkerhetsarbete och bidra till tryggheten för våra över 2 miljoner kunder. Hos oss får du arbeta nära engagerade kollegor och chefer som tar säkerhet på största allvar, i en organisation där samarbete, modern metodik och ett ständigt lärande står i fokus.

### **Om rollen**


I rollen som Information Security Officer, i Avanzas team för informationssäkerhet, kommer du att arbeta brett med styrning av säkerhet och tredjepartsrisk. Ditt arbete bidrar direkt till att säkerställa att Avanza har rätt strukturer, processer och kontrollmiljö för att möta både dagens och framtidens krav.

**Du kommer bland annat att:**

* Vidareutveckla och förvalta vårt Ledningssystem för Informationssäkerhet (LIS) samt formulera interna säkerhetskrav.
  
* Stötta verksamheten som rådgivare i implementering av säkerhetsåtgärder och tolkning av krav.
  
* Mäta och följa upp Avanzas säkerhetsnivå och efterlevnad av interna riktlinjer.
  
* Vara ett generellt säkerhetsstöd genom rådgivning, riskbedömningar och initiativ för att stärka säkerheten.
  
* Vara utpekad specialist för tredjepartsrisk och vidareutveckla vårt arbetssätt för att bedöma, granska och följa upp leverantörers säkerhet.
  
* Genomföra granskningar av våra leverantörers säkerhet.
  


Här får du stort utrymme att påverka arbetssätt, metodik och prioriteringar – och du blir en nyckelperson i Avanzas säkerhetsstyrning.

### **Din profil**


Genom din gedigna erfarenhet inom informationssäkerhet, riskhantering och tredjepartsstyrning blir du en viktig specialistresurs för Avanza och en del av vårt långsiktiga strategiska säkerhetsarbete.

**Vi ser att du har:**

* God kunskap om etablerade ramverk som NIST (CSF, SP 800), ISO 27001, ISO 31000 eller motsvarande.
  
* Stark förståelse för riskhantering, särskilt inom cloud och TPRM (Third-Party Risk Management).
  
* Erfarenhet från reglerade branscher (t.ex. finans eller bank) och vana att arbeta med lagar och regelverk är meriterande men inte krav.
  


För att lyckas i rollen behöver du vara strukturerad, analytisk och kommunikativ. Du är bra på att omsätta komplexa krav till tydliga och praktiska lösningar och trivs i en roll där du samarbetar med många olika intressenter såsom Tech, Legal, Procurement och Risk, samt våra leverantörer.


Du behärskar svenska mycket väl i tal och skrift, då du kommer att driva processer, skriva styrande dokument och leda dialoger med både tekniska och icke-tekniska grupper.

### **Ansökan**


Skicka din ansökan genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök nu” under annonsen. Urval sker löpande, så skicka gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.


Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Hampus Karlsson, Information Security Manager, på *hampus.karlsson@avanza.se*.


Med hänsyn till GDPR tar vi inte emot ansökningar via e-post. Välkommen med din ansökan!

*Erbjudanden från rekryteringsföretag eller annonssäljare undanbedes vänligt men bestämt.*
company_description: Med visionen om att skapa en bättre framtid för miljoner människor går vi till jobbet för att skapa billigare, bättre och enklare produkter och tjänster för våra kunder!

title: Trading System Architect (JVM)
description:
### **About AXB**


AXB is an automated high-frequency trading platform for both cryptocurrency and financial instrument markets.


AXB is a quantitative proprietary trading firm in the crypto asset sector providing liquidity across many instruments across multiple centralized exchange. We leverage our robust in-house technology infrastructure to monitor all market data in real-time, allowing us to gain insights that facilitate the building, implementation, and scaling of new strategies using both machine learning algorithms and those developed by our analytics department.

### **Role Description**


A highly specialised engineer who will bridge the gap between our quantitative trading strategies and our core engineering implementation. We require a senior engineer with deep domain experience in trading systems to guide architectural decisions, ensuring our systems are optimised for market microstructure, latency, and risk safety.


You will act as a high-level technical advisor and individual contributor, validating our architectural path and preventing costly domain-specific mistakes. Your voice will be crucial in defining the system architecture and making technical decisions to ensure optimised order execution.


We value domain experience over raw coding volume. We prefer a solid engineer who has spent years strictly in the trading domain and understands "why" systems fail, over a rockstar developer who has only worked in generic tech. You are pragmatic, focusing on stability and predictable latency over theoretical perfection.

**Technical stack:**

* **Language & approach:** Scala, Cats Effect 3, FS2
* **Architecture:** Microservices, Event Sourcing, Reactive approach
* **Infrastructure:** Docker, Kubernetes, Microservices, Google Cloud Platform, ArgoCD, PostgreSQL, Nats

**Technical challenges we face:**

* **Lots of data** - processing millions of transactions and market pairs data points daily
* **Technical complexity** - integrating with various exchanges requires us to carefully design our software and establish essential monitoring systems to ensure a robust platform
* **Scalability** - developing solutions to process and store millions of transactions for subsequent analysis efficiently
* **Latency** - reducing communication latency across multiple physical regions to a minimum

### **What do you need:**

* Over 5 years of experience working at an HFT firm, market maker, algorithmic trading firm, or top crypto exchange with trading-related responsibilities.
* Considerable expertise in developing systems with sub-millisecond order execution.
* JVM language development background with deep knowledge of the JVM internals.
* Experience in building system architecture for trading systems.
* Familiarity with FIX, WebSocket, and REST API limitations in a trading context.
* Good theoretical knowledge of spot and futures trading internals.
* Proven ability to analyze and solve complex technical problems.
* Familiarity with multithreading concepts and distributed computing.
* Self-motivated with a strong sense of ownership, capable of working independently with minimal supervision.
* Great communication skills with both technical and non-technical people.
* Proficient in both written and spoken English, at a B2 level or higher

### **Nice to have:**

* Scala and/or functional programming experience
* Experience transitioning systems from Cloud (GCP/AWS) to bare-metal or hybrid environments.
* Keen interest in Crypto/Web3

### **Your responsibilities:**

* **Architectural Advisory:** Collaborate with the Head of Technology to define the system architecture. You will provide the domain context needed to make decisions regarding connectivity, execution routing, and state management.
* **Performance Engineering & PoCs:** Research and prototype architectural optimizations. You will not be writing business logic or strategies; instead, you will build Proofs of Concept for high-performance components (e.g., evaluating tools like Aeron, or optimizing order execution).
* **Continuous Performance Analysis:** Regularly profile the production environment with our Performance Engineer. You are responsible for analyzing system behavior *post-factum* to identify latency outliers, performance inefficiencies, and network overheads.
* **System Behavior & Risk Logic:** Ensure the technical implementation aligns with trading realities. This includes validating logic for synthetic market generation (e.g., multi-leg execution risks), handling exchange disconnects, and managing order state during high-volatility events.
* **Provide technical guidance:** Offer technical support throughout the product lifecycle, including the early stages of product development.
* **Technical Mentorship:** Elevate the domain knowledge of the engineering team through design reviews and feedback. You will help generic backend engineers understand the specific constraints of low-latency trading systems.
* **Lead and collaborate with cross-functional teams**: Work closely with engineers, analytics and other teams to navigate through varying levels of detail.

### **What we offer:**

* **Remote-first company** - we enable you to work from anywhere in the world.
* **Flexible working hours** - We have core working hours (11 am–3 pm CET), allowing flexible scheduling outside those hours.
* **38 days of paid vacation leave** - you have 38 days of paid time off per year, and +14 days of paid sick leave
* Join a forward-thinking team where you have the autonomy to make your own choices and explore new ideas.

### **The recruitment process:**

* **Stage 1**: Screening meeting with Talent Acquisition Partner: basic information about ICEO, the project, the role, and the offer. General questions about your experience (about 30 minutes).
* **Stage 2:** Technical Interview with Senior Developer (1 hour).
* **Stage 3:** FinalInterview with Head of Technology (1 hour).

title: Project Manager in Program Office
description:
Clavister is looking to strengthen our Program Office with an additional Project Manager. Our Program Office leads cross-functional projects involving many parts of Clavister, including Product Management, Development, Hardware, Logistics, Marketing and Support. Many projects also include external hardware and software partners, making the role both broad and strategic.


We are looking for someone with proven experience in managing complex projects that span multiple teams and organizations. You are confident presenting to senior stakeholders, and you bring strong structure, analytical ability and problem-solving skills. Your interpersonal skills enable you to navigate collaboration challenges and manage potential conflicts with clarity and professionalism.


We prefer that you hold Swedish citizenship and have strong communication skills in both Swedish and English, spoken and written.

**We offer**

* An opportunity to gain deep insight into the cybersecurity product domain and contribute to the greater good by helping protect critical infrastructure.
* A team of open-minded colleagues with extensive experience, where you collaborate, inspire and grow together.
* A high-tech, multicultural workplace with an engaged and supportive environment where individual commitment truly makes a difference.

**Who we are**


Clavister is a Swedish cybersecurity company founded in 1997, providing solutions within:

* Network security
* Identity and access management
* Cloud security
* 

We focus on four main customer groups: Public Sector, Critical Infrastructure, Defense and Telecommunications. Together with our partners and distributors, Clavister’s hardware and software are used in more than 100 countries.


We know that people are different and believe those differences strengthen us. Our team includes employees from around the world with diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives. By welcoming these differences and enabling everyone to grow, we build a strong team spirit and a sharp customer focus.


You will join us at our office in Örnsköldsvik. For this position we will continuously review and interview qualified applicants so do not hesitate, apply today!


For more information about Clavister or this position, please contact our CTO, Nils Undén, at **nils.unden@clavister.com**.


*This position is subject to a six-month probation period.*

title: Cloud Workspace Engineer
description:
**HAYPP GROUP**


We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose smoke-free enjoyment. How? By offering people other nicotine products online.


Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with eleven store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches, Swedish style snus online as well as disposable vapes. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 300 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to smoke-free alternatives across all our markets globally.

 **THE ROLE**


Ready to transform the way we work?


At Haypp, we’re building smarter, faster, and more secure IT environments and we want you on our team. As our Cloud Workspace Engineer, you’ll design and deliver cutting-edge cloud solutions that keep us agile and ahead of the curve. If you thrive on solving complex challenges, automating processes, and collaborating across teams, this is your chance to make a real impact.  

  

  

  

**WHAT YOU WILL DO:**


Your role as a Cloud Workspace Engineer and IT generalist will be diverse and hands-on. You’ll:  

  



* **Design and deploy cloud workspaces** using Microsoft technologies like Azure AD, Office 365, and SharePoint.
* **Secure and manage endpoints** with Microsoft Intune, Defender, and Purview, ensuring compliance and a seamless user experience across Windows, MacOS, and mobile platforms.
* **Identity & Access Management (IAM)** and maintain **Single Sign-On (SSO)** and MFA across internal and third-party applications.
* **Drive IT projects** that make our systems scalable, compliant, and future-ready, whether migrating legacy systems or rolling out new SaaS solutions.
* **Automate repetitive tasks** using scripting (PowerShell, Bash, Python), from user provisioning to compliance reporting.
* **Maintain and improve IT documentation**, including troubleshooting guides and disaster recovery playbooks.
* **Support cross-functional initiatives**, such as integrating new business apps, optimizing collaboration tools, and enabling secure remote work.
* **Monitor and** **optimize cloud performance**, conduct audits, and implement best practices for data protection and disaster recovery.

  

**Examples of Projects You Might** **Managed:**

* Migrating legacy systems to Microsoft 365 for a modern, cloud-first workplace.
* Rolling out Zero Trust security architecture, including conditional access and MFA.
* Automating employee onboarding workflows with scripts for provisioning accounts and devices.
* Implementing advanced compliance and data protection measures using Microsoft Purview.
* Integrating new SaaS applications with seamless SSO and IAM configurations.
* Optimizing Teams and SharePoint for better collaboration in hybrid teams.
* Developing disaster recovery strategies and conducting failover tests.
Building dashboards for IT asset management and security posture monitoring.  
* 

  

**What** **We’re Looking For:**

  

* Proficiency in **Azure** and **Microsoft 365** tools and services.
* Experience in Windows endpoint management; MacOS, iOS, and Android knowledge is a plus.
* Expertise in IAM and SSO federation protocols.
* Familiarity with IT Service Management and Asset Management.
* Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, IT, or equivalent experience.
Certifications like Microsoft 365 Certified: Enterprise Administrator Expert is a plus.  
* 

  

**YOU WILL THRIVE HERE IF YOU:**

* Likes taking ownership and thrives on responsibility, someone who sees challenges as opportunities to deliver impact.
* Has a strong commitment to quality and security, ensuring every solution is reliable and future-proof.
* Is proactive and resourceful, always looking for ways to improve processes and automate repetitive tasks.
* Brings collaboration and adaptability, working seamlessly with different teams and stakeholders.
Maintains a continuous learning mindset, staying ahead of tech trends and embracing innovation.  
* 

  

**WHAT WE OFFER**


We are a value driven company with our values *We team up*, *Innovation Drives Us*, *Inclusion and Non-Hierarchy* and *Going the Extra Mile* at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.


Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:

  

* Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
* Insurance plan, including private healthcare
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Parental pay lift
* Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
* Lots of social happenings

 **SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!**


If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application!


Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.

  

If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Lea Sjösten at lea.sjosten@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: NetOps Engineer
description:
**Looking for a place where you can challenge yourself, build serious tech and have a good time doing it?**

At Redeploy, we design, build, scale and maintain modern solutions across Cloud, Data and AI, helping ambitious companies across the Nordics transform how they work with technology. As a trusted partner to Microsoft, AWS and Databricks, we deliver platforms that are built for impact and built to last.


What sets us apart is the way we work. Curiosity runs deep here, as does the drive to keep learning and sharing. You’ll join a team that values ownership, collaboration, and high technical standards, and where people genuinely care about doing things well. For our clients. And for each other.

**What you’ll do**

As a NetOps Engineer, you’ll join our Ops team in Stockholm and abroad, and work closely with one of our largest enterprise clients. Your main focus will be operating, improving and troubleshooting their Fortigate environment, while navigating a complex network setup spanning on-prem components and Azure cloud.


Your work will range from daily tickets and change requests to deeper troubleshooting, log analysis, policy refinement, and larger initiatives such as network segmentation or cloud networking improvements. The environment is large, fast-moving, and business-critical, giving you plenty of opportunities to learn, collaborate, and solve real problems with experienced engineers.


You’ll primarily work from our Stockholm office, with flexibility to work from home at times, and occasional on-site days at the client’s office when the work calls for it. This role also includes a rotating on-call schedule (one week at a time, with additional compensation).


**What you’ll grow into**

You’ll deepen your skills in Fortigate, FortiManager, cloud networking and enterprise-scale ops. But your growth won’t stop at this client. As Redeploy continues to build out its networking capabilities, you’ll be able to work on additional NetOps projects, influence our network practice and collaborate across delivery teams.


If you’re curious about cloud, you’ll find clear paths into CloudOps, automation, IaC and hybrid cloud operations. Whether you want to specialise further in networking or expand into broader cloud-focused ops, we’ll help you shape a direction that aligns with your strengths and ambitions.

**Who we’re looking for**

You have solid hands-on experience with Fortigate firewalls and enjoy tackling complex network challenges. You take ownership, stay organised under pressure, and collaborate well with others who value clean, reliable and well-engineered solutions. You communicate clearly, think proactively, and feel confident working independently when needed.


Fluency in English is required, and Swedish is a strong advantage.

 **What experiences you bring**

* Hands-on expertise with Fortigate firewalls (rule creation, security profiles, IPSec VPNs, log analysis, troubleshooting).
* Experience working with FortiManager (sync status, pushing changes, working safely in the platform).
* Strong networking fundamentals at a CCNA-equivalent level: VLANs, trunk/access ports, port-channels, routing (BGP/OSPF), switch configuration.
* Understanding of cloud networking on a major cloud platform (Azure, AWS or GCP).
* Ability to self-manage and deliver reliably in a demanding ops environment.

**Experience with any of the following is a bonus**

* Broader Fortinet products
* Check Point, Aruba SD-WAN, zScaler, Infoblox or Algosec
* Terraform or Ansible
* CI/CD tooling
* Advanced Azure or AWS networking knowledge
  

**Curious to know more?** Have a look around our career site to explore our culture, people and way of working. And if you have any questions, feel free to reach out to our Talent Acquisition Manager, Francisca Andersson.

title: Senior Analytics Engineer
description:
You know that bit where every company says they’re *“changing the world”*? Yeah, it can feel a little forced. But we like to think our story actually has some realness to it.
