Our story begins with Shadi Bitar and Ninos Malki, who came to Sweden from Syria as kids and discovered that books could be a bridge - helping them learn the language, understand the culture, and explore new worlds.


A thought emerged, *what if everyone could have that?* And just like that, Nextory was born - your all-access pass to read, listen, and discover new perspectives without limits.


And now, *we're on a quest to find our Senior Analytics Engineer, someone* as passionate as we are about making the world a happier place and enriching lives through the world of reading.  

  

**Let us tell you about the role**  

As a Senior Analytics Engineer at Nextory, you’ll help bring the power of data to life. Your mission is to transform business needs into reliable and value-creating data assets that fuel smart decisions. You’ll be part of our Central Data Team ,together with data scientist/analyst, working very closely with stakeholders across the organization to turn complex requirements into structured, trustworthy and insight-ready data models. By building our next-generation data platform, you’ll push the boundaries of what great analytics engineering looks like at scale.


In this role, you will:

* Collaborate with stakeholders to define and translate analytics and data requirements into actionable solutions.
* Map and analyze business processes to ensure data models and transformations reflect accurate, value-aligned logic.
* Design and implement scalable SQL-based data models and pipelines across DAS, DAB, and DAR, while maintaining and evolving the Dataform transformation layer.
* Ensure data quality through large-scale SQL validation, monitoring, troubleshooting, and continuous improvements.
* Maintain YAML-based data contracts, support product teams with ingestion pipelines, and manage the semantic layer and BI tooling ecosystem.

**The main character we’re looking for**  

We believe that you are a solution-oriented analytics professional with a strong understanding of how business processes shape real value. You’re driven by turning complex requirements into clean, reliable and well-structured data models. Collaboration comes naturally to you, both within the team and in partnerships with stakeholders across the organization.You communicate fluently in English and hold a relevant educational background within data, engineering, or analytics, or have gained equivalent experience through your work.


Furthermore, we believe you have:

* 5+ years of experience working with SQL-first data engineering in a cloud environment, ideally across different data stacks.
* Very strong SQL skills and hands-on experience designing scalable transformations and pipelines.
* Proven experience with at least one physical data modeling technique (e.g., Kimball, Data Vault, Anchor, Focal) and a curiosity to deepen your knowledge.

A solid understanding of layered data architecture (raw semantic* consumption) and why clear separation improves resilience when source systems change
* Experience with, *or a strong willingness to learn,* schema-as-code approaches where documentation and implementation are one and the same.

**The Nextory way of working**  

At Nextory, we believe a strong and inclusive culture is key to our success - and that culture flourishes when we meet and collaborate in person as much as possible. That’s why we spend the majority of the working time at our beautiful office!


We are based in Stockholm, Sweden, with offices in Paris and Bangalore. Our hybrid work policy includes four days in the office and Wednesdays as a work-from-home day.

**Your next story starts here**  

We look forward to your application - let’s create a world where stories are always within reach, one word at a time. Applications are reviewed continuously. If you have any questions about the role, please contact erika.thorslund@nextory.com

*Please note that we do not offer relocation and that a six-month probationary period applies.*

title: Data Analytics Engineer (Azure & ETL)
description:
We are looking for a **Senior** **Data** **Analytics** **Engineer for a global company in Gothenburg.**

**Start is January 2026, 6 months limited contract to begin with, possibility of extension after that.**

 **About the Role:**


As an Analytics Data Engineer, you will design, develop, and maintain scalable systems for data processing, storage, and retrieval. Your work will ensure reliable, high-quality data that powers analytics, reporting, and data-driven decision-making across the organization. You’ll collaborate closely with product owners and cross-functional teams to build a modern data platform that supports our business growth.

**Responsibilities:**

* Design, implement, and optimize end-to-end data pipelines, enabling efficient flow from diverse data sources to storage and analytics systems.
* Develop and maintain data models that support analytical, reporting, and operational needs, ensuring data integrity, performance, and security.
* Build and maintain ETL/ELT processes to transform raw data into clean, structured, and usable formats.
* Ensure a sustainable, scalable architecture for our data platform, including integration with various data sources and destinations.
* Work cross-functionally to translate data requirements into actionable engineering solutions.
* Establish and maintain analytics capabilities in a multi-tenant cloud environment.
* Contribute to data modelling for optimal query performance.
* Support and maintain the analytics platform, ensuring reliability and continuous improvement.

**Profile & Background:**

* A proactive, driven problem-solver with the ability to adapt to shifting priorities.
* Strong understanding of modern digital technologies and architectural principles for data analytics.
* Experience with analytics platforms and data modelling.
* Expertise in the Microsoft Azure analytics stack (ADF, Databricks, Synapse, Data Lake/Lakehouse, Data Pipelines).
* Experience building data flows for social media, streaming, batch, and big data sources.
* Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills.
* Excellent communication skills and fluency in English (written and spoken).
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, IT, Data Science, or a related field.

  

This is a full-time consultant position in Gothenburg through Incluso. Start is in January 2026, 6 monthslimited contract to begin with, possibility of extension.  

  

Please submit your CV as soon as possible since we will review the applications on an on-going basis.


For more information about this role, please contact Kanika Singhalrecruiter at Incluso.

title: Senior Azure Platform Architect
description:
**Role description**  

We are looking for a collaborative and hands-on senior Azure specialist to lead Azure-based platform initiatives with a strong focus on Identity & Access Management (IAM). In this role, you will drive architectural discussions, shape integration approaches and bring structure to a complex, fast-moving environment. You are expected to make clear, well-founded decisions, guide teams in solid technical practices and support the organization throughout a broad cloud transformation.

**Responsibilities**

* Lead the development of Azure infrastructure and IAM capabilities in close collaboration with platform owners, architects, cloud specialists and other stakeholders.
* Steer architectural discussions and define target architectures, integration patterns and platform principles for the Azure environment.
* Contribute to the setup of a new Azure tenant, including onboarding of core platforms and introduction of new services as the environment evolves.
* Define and improve access processes for external partners to ensure secure, smooth and scalable collaboration.
* Anticipate future infrastructure and IAM needs, identify risks and propose mitigations from both a technical and process perspective.
* Provide an external, objective perspective that strengthens ways of working, transition planning and long-term scalability of the platform.
* Support teams in adopting sound technical practices, including governance, security, documentation and alignment with overall cloud strategy.
* Make well-grounded decisions and give direction even when information is incomplete or conditions are unclear.

**Requirements**

* Extensive experience working with Microsoft Azure and cloud platform architectures.
* Strong expertise in Identity & Access Management (IAM) in Azure-focused environments.
* Solid background in designing and leading cloud platform initiatives in complex organizations.
* Proven ability to work methodically and proactively in high-tempo, change-intensive settings.
* Demonstrated experience making clear, well-reasoned decisions with incomplete information.
* Ability to provide direction and structure when conditions are ambiguous and challenges are complex.
* Strong stakeholder management skills and experience collaborating with platform owners, architects and technical specialists.
* Excellent communication skills in English, both spoken and written.

**Preferred qualifications**

* Experience from large-scale cloud transformations in enterprise environments.
* Experience setting up or restructuring Azure tenants, including onboarding of multiple platforms and services.
* Background in establishing or refining cloud governance, security models and access processes for external partners.
* Experience working in cross-functional, agile teams within cloud, infrastructure or platform domains.

**Start:** 2025-12-15  

**Duration:** Until 2026-08-04  

**Location:** Malmö, Sweden

**About Rasulson Consulting**  

Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm within the IT sector. We partner with established technology companies as well as innovative startups to offer attractive career opportunities for professionals looking to grow within digital development and IT. With our strong technical expertise and extensive network, we effectively match the right consultant with the right assignment. At Rasulson Consulting, you will receive personalized guidance, ongoing feedback, and the opportunity to take the next step in your career.

title: Engineering Manager – Data & Analytics Engineering i Stockholm/Oslo
description:
### **Om uppdraget**

Data & Analytics Engineering är uppdelat i etablerade subgrupper med fokus på backend, frontend och data management inom data engineering. I rollen som Engineering Manager ansvarar du för en av subgrupperna och får en central position i att vidareutveckla både våra data-specialister och vår datatekniska förmåga.


Du leder ett team med Data Engineers och Data Quality Engineers och driver initiativ som stärker organisationens dataplattform, förbättrar dataanvändningen och säkrar att data fortsätter vara en strategisk tillgång.


### **Dina arbetsuppgifter**

Leda och utveckla ett av teamen inom Data & Analytics Engineering med personalansvar och tydligt fokus på teamets leverans och kompetensutveckling.


Äga och driva datalösningar, migreringar och projekt inom data management-området, inklusive etablering av nya lösningar på cloud-baserade dataplattformar. ️


Säkerställa effektiv och värdeskapande användning av data i organisationens data assets.


Delat produktägarskap för planering, prioritering och genomförande av datarelaterade initiativ och roadmap-arbete. ️


Ha tekniskt helhetsansvar för ditt områdes datalösningar samt vägleda både teamet och relevanta stakeholders. ️


Bidra med stark teknisk ledning inom data engineering, driva best practices i utveckling, migrering och deployment samt leda tekniska implementationer och utrullningar.


**Förväntade leveranser**
-------------------------

Stabilt ledarskap och en tydlig riktning för teamets leverans, arbetssätt och utveckling. ‍


Genomförda dataprojekt och migreringar som stärker vår cloud-plattform och data management-förmåga.


Förbättrad kvalitet, tillgänglighet och användbarhet i data assets.


Roadmaps och prioriteringar som är förankrade med verksamheten och leder till mätbart värde.


Etablerade arbetssätt och standarder som säkrar moderna och hållbara data engineering-lösningar. ️


**Din profil**
--------------

Akademisk examen på kandidat- eller masternivå inom datavetenskap, data science, engineering eller närliggande område.


Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom data engineering eller relaterat område, varav minst 2 år i en ledande eller managerroll.


Dokumenterat starkt ledarskap och förmåga att inspirera, coacha och utveckla team av data-specialister.


Erfarenhet av tekniskt ledarskap inom data engineering, inklusive att leda deployment och driva adoption av moderna arbetssätt.


Djup kompetens inom data engineering och analytics: data warehousing, ETL/ELT, datamodellering och data visualisering.


Vana att leda datarelaterade projekt/produkter med roadmap-planering, genomförande och leveransansvar.


**Meriterande**


Hands-on erfarenhet av Microsoft Azure, Databricks, DBT, Python eller liknande tekniker.


**Personliga egenskaper**
-------------------------

Du trivs i en snabb, föränderlig miljö där du är flexibel när prioriteringar skiftar. Du drivs av att leda och utveckla människor och bygger samarbetsinriktade team som levererar tillsammans.


Komplexa datautmaningar engagerar dig och du tar dig an dem med nyfikenhet och ett lösningsorienterat förhållningssätt.


Du värdesätter lärande, samarbete och att driva initiativ som stärker den gemensamma dataplattformen och skapar långsiktigt affärsvärde.


**Plats:** Stockholm eller Oslo (teamet är fördelat mellan båda orterna)
  

**Omfattning:** Heltid ️  

**Period:** Tillsvidare
  

**Sista ansökningsdag:** Asap


Sway Sourcing är en innovativ rekryteringspartner som specialiserar sig på att matcha rätt talang med rätt företag – snabbt och effektivt. Vårt huvudfokus ligger inom Ekonomi, Administration, HR, Marknad och IT, men vi har även den breda expertis och flexibilitet som krävs för att leverera skräddarsydda rekryteringslösningar inom alla branscher.


Trots att vi är en relativt ny aktör har vi redan byggt förtroende hos många av Sveriges största företag och arbetar både nationellt och internationellt. Med baser i Sverige och Spanien erbjuder vi en unik kombination av lokal expertis och global räckvidd. Vårt starka nätverk och djupa branschinsikter gör oss till en självklar partner för företag som vill ligga steget före i sin rekrytering.

title: Partner Business Manager - HPE Networking
description:
This role has been designed as ‘Hybrid’ with an expectation that you will work on average 2 days per week from an HPE office.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know varied backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.
   

  

**Job Description**
 HPE Networking in Sweden is looking for a talented
 **Partner Business Manager** 
 to join the team.
   

  

**In a typical day as a Partner Business Manager – HPE Networking you would:**
* Serve as a trusted advisor to the Partner on where to play within emerging trends in Partner's ecosystem in alignment with HPE business priorities.
* Hunt and grow with and for new partners is key focus.
* Work with the Partner to create a mutually beneficial plan for the future.
* Drive end-to end HPE revenue, profitability, and pipeline by creating joint business plans and leading data-driven sales efforts with the Partner.
* Develop solid knowledge of partner priorities, industry trends, IT landscape, IT investment strategy, HPE priorities, and HPE Technology and communicates value of the portfolios and solutions to better differentiate HPE from competitors.
* Demonstrate business and sales leadership by building mutually beneficial relationships with Partners to grow HPE market share.
* Coordinate and execute HPE activities with the Partner, leveraging HPE specialists when needed, including sales cadence, education, marketing, executive briefings, proactive forecasting, business planning, and client engagements. Drives HPE marketing strategy through the customer.
* Drive and implement HPE strategy, programs, and systems with and on behalf of the Partner to assure accelerated financial outcomes and build partner loyalty to HPE


**Your Background And Skills**
* University or Bachelor's degree preferred, or equivalent experience.
* Typically 5+ years of experience in IT Sales.
* Experience in working with partners and within network and security are beneficial
* Solid awareness of current technology trends and related HPE strategy and ability to articulate same to Partner.
* Solid understanding of business and financial fundamentals to develop strategic plans with the partner that are aligned to customer and HPE strategies, creating increased business opportunities and value for HPE.
* You’re curious, eager to learn and able to adapt to a fast-paced environment
* You’re a team player
* Solid understanding of Partner industry, trends, competitors, and the channel.
* Ability to look forward and anticipate partner needs, proactively forecasting sales quota and effectively bridging sales gaps.
* Professional, clear, and effective verbal and written communication.
* Fluent Swedish and English languages


**Additional Skills**
 Accountability, Accountability, Active Learning, Active Listening, Assertiveness, Bias, Building Rapport, Buyer Personas, Coaching, Complex Sales, Creativity, Critical Thinking, Cross-Functional Teamwork, Customer Experience Strategy, Customer Interactions, Design Thinking, Empathy, Financial Acumen, Follow-Through, Growth Mindset, Identifying Sales Opportunities, Industry Knowledge, Intellectual Curiosity (Inactive), Long Term Planning, Managing Ambiguity {+ 6 more}
   

  

**What We Can Offer You**
**Health & Wellbeing**
 We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.
   

  

**Personal & Professional Development**
 We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have — whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.
   

  

**Unconditional Inclusion**
 We are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness. We know varied backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good.
   

  

**Let's Stay Connected**
 Follow @HPECareers on Instagram to see the latest on people, culture and tech at HPE.
   

  

 #sweden
   

  

 #aruba
   

  

**Job**
 Sales
   

  

**Job Level**
 Expert
   

  

 HPE is an Equal Employment Opportunity/ Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, or any other protected category, and all decisions we make are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Our goal is to be one global team that is representative of our customers, in an inclusive environment where we can continue to innovate and grow together. Please click here: Equal Employment Opportunity.
   

  

**Hewlett Packard Enterprise is EEO Protected Veteran/ Individual with Disabilities.**
 HPE will comply with all applicable laws related to employer use of arrest and conviction records, including laws requiring employers to consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories.
   

  

**No Fees Notice & Recruitment Fraud Disclaimer**
*It has come to HPE’s attention that there has been an increase in recruitment fraud whereby scammer impersonate HPE or HPE-authorized recruiting agencies and offer fake employment opportunities to candidates. These scammers often seek to obtain personal information or money from candidates.*
*Please note that Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE), its direct and indirect subsidiaries and affiliated companies, and its authorized recruitment agencies/vendors
 **will never charge any candidate a registration fee, hiring fee, or any other fee in connection with its recruitment and hiring process.** 
 The credentials of any hiring agency that claims to be working with HPE for recruitment of talent should be verified by candidates and candidates shall be solely responsible to conduct such verification. Any candidate/individual who relies on the erroneous representations made by fraudulent employment agencies does so at their own risk, and HPE disclaims liability for any damages or claims that may result from any such communication.*

title: Solution Architect
description:
**About Hubexo**
 We provide cutting-edge data, insights, and software solutions to the global construction industry. We specialise in project information, eTendering, product information, market intelligence, and specification. We help the world build better by delivering unrivalled insights and technology that shape places where people live, work and play.
   

  

**Work Environment**
 As part of our Content Tech Tribe, you will work at the heart of Hubexo's global data and content ecosystem. You will collaborate closely with our Content Tech Director (based in Sweden), architects across the organisation, and multiple engineering and product squads.
   

  

 You will be part of a highly collaborative, cross-functional environment where architects and engineering teams work together to build global, high-impact solutions using AWS, serverless design, and automated data processing.
   

  

**Your Role**
 As a Solution Architect, you will own the architectural direction for our global content authoring, content management, and data ingestion platforms. Your work will shape a modern, scalable, and high-performing environment that powers the applications and products our customers rely on every day.
   

  

 You will also help define how we use AWS, serverless technologies, automated data processing, APIs, and AI services to build the next generation of Hubexo's content solutions.
   

  

**This Is What You'll Be Doing**
* You will own and lead the solution architecture for our content authoring and management platforms.
* You will design scalable, event-driven ingestion and enrichment pipelines that run at scale and support high throughput and low latency.
* You will define our API strategy for GraphQL and REST and ensure consistent patterns across teams.
* You will design observability across these platforms, including monitoring, logging, tracing, and alerting.
* You will embed security and compliance into every architectural decision and flow.
* You will identify opportunities to use AI, machine learning, and LLM-based services to enhance our data and platform capabilities.
* You will work with architects across the organisation to align principles and technical direction.
* You will support and mentor squads focused on data ingestion, enrichment, low-code development, APIs, and internal authoring tools.


**Requirements**
**Your Core Competencies**
* 8+ years in Solution, Cloud, or Software Architecture
* Deep hands-on experience with AWS and cloud-native design
* 3+ years designing scalable data pipelines / ETL / event-driven systems
* Strong expertise in API design (REST & GraphQL)
* Proven ability to build observability, ensuring performance, reliability, and data quality
* Strong focus on security and compliance in every architectural decision
* Ability to explain complex ideas clearly and collaborate effectively with engineering and product teams
* English proficiency at C1 level


**Your Additional Qualifications**
* Experience with event-driven architectures (Kafka, Pulsar, Kinesis, EventBridge)
* Hands-on software engineering experience (ideally in data pipelines)
* Experience with data scraping and enrichment tooling
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or similar
* Curiosity, innovation mindset, and ownership of high-impact architectural work


**Benefits**
**Why Hubexo**
 We're not here to coast - we're here to challenge, grow, and build better. For our people and for our customers. That means we'll expect a lot from you: ownership, precision, and a drive to lead by example. In return, you'll get the space to dream big, take smart risks, and be seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

**Ready to build your future?**
 At Hubexo, we are united by our vision to empower the construction industry with our innovative insights and technology. We like to dream big and thrive together. If you're ready to be part of one global team that is helping to shape the future of construction and build a better world, join us!

title: Senior Cloud Operations Lead
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Erfarenhet av teknisk ledning inom moln (gärna Azure)
* Erfarenhet av automation, CI/CD och SRE-inspirerade arbetssätt
* Förmåga att etablera och följa upp OKR/KPI
* Stark kompetens inom molnarkitektur och drift i enterprise-miljö
* Erfarenhet av processmodellering för drift är meriterande
* Vana att facilitera workshops och förankra förändringar


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 05-12-2025
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Junior Engineer - Build Real Systems, Learn Every Day
description:
*Are you ready to turn your computer science degree into real-world impact? We’re looking for a Junior Engineer to join Henriksson Storage, a fast-growing tech-driven company modernizing the self-storage industry across Europe. You’ll work directly with our Tech Lead to develop, deploy, and maintain systems that keep our storage sites connected and our customers happy.* 




  





*It’s a hands-on role - you’ll learn fast, get broad exposure, and see your work make a visible difference.* 




  





**What You’ll Do** 




  





*Site Tech & Operations* 



* Help set up and maintain connectivity, networks, and IP cameras at our storage sites.
* Support automation of on-site systems (access control, sensors, monitoring).
* Troubleshoot and improve performance across hardware and software layers.



  





*Software & Integration* 



* Write and maintain small tools and scripts in Python.
* Work with Linux and Docker environments for running and deploying systems.
* Assist in connecting our internal and external systems via APIs.



  





*Learning & Development* 



* You’ll learn a lot on the job - from networking and cloud tools to real-world automation.
* Work side-by-side with an experienced Tech Lead who’ll help you grow into a broader engineering role.
* Gain end-to-end insight into how tech and operations work together in a scaling business.



  





**What You Bring** 




  




* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or similar.
* **Core skills** 
 : Comfortable with 
 **Linux** 
  command line, proficient in 
 **Python** 
 programming
* Curiosity about systems, networks, and real-world tech operations.
* Hands-on mindset - you like building, testing, and improving things.
* Willingness to learn new technologies as you go - most things you’ll pick up here.



  





**Why Join Henriksson Storage** 




  





 Henriksson Storage is scaling fast, bringing smart, tech-enabled self-storage to cities across Europe.
 



 We combine modern hardware, automation, and software to make storage easier and more accessible.You’ll join early, learn directly from senior engineers and founders, and grow into a key technical contributor as we expand internationally.
 



  





**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
 



  





 Questions? Drop us a line at: careers@henriksson.com

title: Datacenter Technician
description:
**Who are we?**
 Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company®, shortening the path to connectivity to enable the innovations that enrich our work, life and planet.
   

  

 A place where bold ideas are welcomed, human connection is valued, and everyone has the opportunity to shape their future.
   

  

 Joining our operations team means being at the center of everything – maintaining and evolving critical infrastructure that powers the digital world and delivers real impact for our customers, communities and society. You’ll find belonging, purpose, and a team that welcomes you—because when you feel valued, you’re empowered to do your best work.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 Applies acquired job skills to work on tasks that are semi-routine in nature. Focus is on semi-routine tasks within standard operating procedures. Supports the overall team.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 Installations
   

  

* Installs cages, cabinets, cable containments, cabinets and customer equipment
* Installs & modify Cold Aisle Containments to ensure optimal Airflow


 Cross Connects
   

  

* Installs/Tests/Modifies cross connects per SOPs and ensures proper cable management of: fiber, twisted pair copper and intra-building cross connects
* Installs and tests advanced cross connects circuits (switched, multiplexed, etc.)
* Installs and test Data Center Link cross connects using Fluke


 Ticket Management
   

  

* Determines work priorities from the ticket system queue (eg. Siebel) and ensures adherence to all commitment times


 Testing/Troubleshooting
   

  

* Conducts carrier circuit testing


 Documentation/Reporting
   

  

* Maintains detailed written records of all work activity


 Facility Upkeep
   

  

* Support Facility Engineers by performing visual inspections while reporting and resolving issues


 Projects
   

  

* Supports senior staff on large scale projects


 Training
   

  

* Completes all assigned training in a timely manner. Equinix have an in-depth Training and development program designed to help new employees adjust to the workplace successfully, plus on-the-job-training, which helps new starters obtain the knowledge and skills they need to complete their tasks through a systematic training program


 Customer Management
   

  

* Supports customer satisfaction through timely and precise order execution


**Qualifications**
 Essential
   

  

* Well-versed in both written and spoken English language
* Basic Computer skills – MS Office
* Experience in customer service
* Previous experience in a technical role
* Works in a shift rotation that includes day / night shifts / weekends / holidays


 Desirable
   

  

* Basic understanding of Swedish is a big plus (not a requirement)


 Equinix is committed to ensuring that our employment process is open to all individuals, including those with a disability. If you are a qualified candidate and need assistance or an accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
   

  

 Equinix is an Equal Employment Opportunity and, in the U.S., an Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to unlawful consideration of race, color, religion, creed, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, place of birth, citizenship, sex, pregnancy / childbirth or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic partnership status, age, veteran or military status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, political / organizational affiliation, status as a victim or family member of a victim of crime or abuse, or any other status protected by applicable law.

title: Partneransvarig vård med verksamhetsstöd
description:
**Om rollen**
 Vi söker en Partneransvarig vård till Joint Academy med huvuduppdrag att etablera, utveckla och driva samarbeten med vårdcentraler och andra vårdgivare. Rollen syftar till att öka inflödet av patienter till våra kliniker genom långsiktiga, kvalitativa vårdsamarbeten. Utöver detta bistår du vår VD och verksamheten med administrativt stöd samt uppföljning av processer och nyckeltal.
   

  

 Tjänsten utgår från Stockholm och omfattar samarbete med våra sju kliniker inom Vårdval Primärvårdsrehabilitering och Vårdval Rehab. Rollen är central för vår tillväxt och kräver både strategisk förmåga och praktiskt genomförande i kontakten med externa vårdaktörer.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga ansvarsområden**
**Vårdsamarbeten (ca 50 %)**
* Etablera, utveckla och samordna samarbeten med vårdcentraler och andra vårdgivare
* Planera och hålla presentationer, informationsmöten och utbildningsinsatser om vårt erbjudande
* Säkerställa uppföljning av samarbeten kopplat till remissflöden och patientinflöde
* Utveckla arbetssätt, presentationsmaterial och uppföljningsrutiner för hållbara partnerskap
* Stödja enhetschefer och kliniker i aktiviteter som stärker synlighet och remissvägar


**Administration och verksamhetsstöd (ca 50 %)**
* Stötta VD i löpande administration, planering och uppföljning
* Utveckla och effektivisera administrativa processer, inklusive digitala bokningsflöden och åtgärder som minskar avbokningar
* Följa upp nyckeltal, styrkort och efterlevnad av rutiner
* Hantera initiala delar av rekryteringsprocesser inklusive annonsering, urval och intervjubokning
* Utföra HR-administration som lönerapportering, intyg, frånvaro och semester
* Ansvara för arbetsmiljörutiner enligt årshjul tillsammans med skyddsombud
* Bidra med underlag till budget, bonusmodeller och verksamhetsuppföljning
* Stödja kommunikations- och marknadsföringsinsatser riktade mot patienter och samarbetspartners


**Vi söker dig som**
* Har erfarenhet av relationsskapande roll inom vård, samverkansansvar eller partner-/kundansvar inom tjänstesektorn
* Har bakgrund inom administration, HR eller ledningsstöd, gärna inom vård eller annan reglerad verksamhet
* Är resultatinriktad och skicklig på att bygga långsiktiga professionella relationer
* Är strukturerad, självdriven och van att hantera flera parallella uppgifter
* Har intresse för digitalisering och utveckling av effektiva processer
* Kommunicerar professionellt och tydligt på svenska och engelska


**Vi erbjuder**
* En roll med direkt påverkan på verksamhetens tillväxt och utveckling
* Möjlighet att forma hur vårdsamarbeten etableras och följs upp
* Nära samarbete med ledning och enhetschefer i hela organisationen
* Kompetensutveckling inom både samverkan och verksamhetsstyrning
* Tjänstepension och försäkringar
* Moderna lokaler i Nacka Forum samt möjlighet till distansarbete vissa dagar


**Om Joint Academy**
 Joint Academy är en global ledare inom digital och klinisk behandling av långvarig ledsmärta, med verksamhet i Sverige, USA och England och över 150 000 behandlade patienter.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**This is Coody**
 We’re one of Sweden’s fastest-growing tech consultancies, expanding in both people and revenue. We attribute our growth to our simple yet powerful approach to Gravity-Free Consulting, combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 At Coody, we believe in freedom, trust, and ambition which means you’ll feel like a freelancer with free rein on assignments that excite you, while enjoying the benefits of being employed by a company that invests in your growth.
   

  

 Our senior sales team has built a vast, carefully curated client network, enabling our consultants to work with some of the most innovative companies in Sweden, Finland, the US, and the UK across Gaming, Fintech, Medtech, AI, SaaS, Aviation, and Automotive, tackling real technical challenges while shaping their own career paths.
   

  

 We’re a
 **diverse community of ambitious tech professionals** 
 , representing more than
 **14 nationalities** 
 .
   

  

**Coody is more of a** 
**platform than a traditional consultancy** 
 . Everything we do is designed to help you work and live according to your own priorities and ambitions. If you’re curious to see how this works in practice,
 **explore our Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that truly puts consultants first.
   

  

**Why Coody**
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a lean and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no extravagant conferences. Instead we give you:
   

  

**Maximized Compensation.** 
 Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 . No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security.** 
 Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shape the Future.** 
 Projects and assignments for digital game changers like Spotify, Hemnet, Visa, Tobii, Toca Boca, Mojang, Flightradar24, SJ, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 As a
 **Senior Machine Learning Engineer** 
 at Coody, you'll take on fullstack Machine Learning Assignments covering the full spectra from GenAI, developing and training models in production, and building cloud platforms where they can run. Each assignment is 6–24 months and will give you both broadness and deepness from various industries and companies. Often, we play a key role for the project, product and team we work in. You will dive into complex systems, ramping up fast, and delivering real impact from day one. Beyond coding and training models, you’ll influence product direction, and fostering a collaborative, high-trust team culture.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We believe that you have about
 **4+ years of experience** 
 and a proven track record of delivering real results within Machine Learning. If you’ve got the following, you’re probably a great fit:
   

  

* A track-record of building and training ML models in production
* Cloud experience (AWS, GCP, Azure, Docker, Kubernetes)
* Experience with commonly used data tools (e.g., Spark, Dask, PySpark, Apache Beam)
* Expertise in Python and modern ML/AI libraries (PyTorch/TensorFlow, Transformers, LangChain, LangGraph, Vertex AI)
* Strong understanding of ML infrastructure: deployment, monitoring, debugging, optimization
* A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or similar
* You must be based in Sweden with a Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency
* Fluent in English (spoken and written)


**How To Apply**
 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criteria? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly!

title: Delivery Roll-Out Lead
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Job Description**
* Maintain and communicate overall roll-out timelines in collaboration with relevant stakeholders
* Keep task lists and risk registers updated and visible to all involved parties.
* Facilitate alignment meetings and ensure clear communication of progress, risks, and dependencies.
* Assist in defining and keeping KPIs relevant and updated
* Support teams in resolving blockers by connecting them with the right resources and stakeholders.
* Prepare and organize status updates and risk reviews for leadership and stakeholders.
* Monitor roll-out progress and escalate issues when timelines or deliverables are at risk.
* Organize and facilitate retrospectives to capture learnings and improvements for future roll-outs.
* Drive continuous improvement in roll-out practices and tools to enhance efficiency and collaboration.


**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Structured and proactive with strong organizational skills.
* Ability to manage multiple stakeholders and keep everyone aligned.
* Strong understanding of operational processes and change management principles.
* Strong communication skills—able to convey complex information clearly and effectively.
* Problem-solving mindset with the ability to anticipate risks and propose mitigations.


**Application deadline:** 
 05-12-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
**About Us**
**nShift** 
 is the leading global provider of cloud delivery management solutions (SaaS), we enable the frictionless shipment and return of almost one billion shipments across 190 countries each year. We are headquartered in London and Oslo and have over 500 employees across offices in Sweden, Finland, Norway, Denmark, the United Kingdom, Poland, the Netherlands, Belgium, and Romania.
   

  

 Our software is used by many of the world leading e-commerce, retail, manufacturing, and 3PL shippers due to us having over 1000 carriers integrated into our platform, nearly 3 times more than our competitors!
   

  

 If you buy goods online, there is a strong chance that nShift has powered that delivery, so come and join us as we shape the future of shipping, one frictionless journey at a time.
   

  

**Purpose of Role**
 We’re looking for a proactive, analytical, and detail-oriented
 **Site Reliability Engineer (SRE)** 
 to join our high-performing team. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a collaborative environment where you’ll help ensure the stability, performance, and scalability of nShift’s SaaS platform.
   

  

 Your main responsibility will be ensuring the operational availability and reliability of our platform and the underlying infrastructure that supports our customers globally. You’ll work closely with software engineers to configure, monitor, and optimize systems and applications, while continuously seeking opportunities to automate and improve our operations.
   

  

**The area of responsibility includes:**
 All team members share responsibilities related to the operational availability and reliability of the SaaS platform and application support. The duties include:
   

  

* Configuration and maintenance of hosted systems and related infrastructure
* Configuration and maintenance of applications in close collaboration with software engineers
* Performance tuning of systems and applications to handle large data volumes and ensure 24/7 availability
* Monitoring of systems, applications, and services to maintain stability and reliability
* Troubleshooting of incidents, with ownership up to the OS-application boundary
* Continuous improvement and optimization of team procedures and operational practices
* Participating in the on-call rotation outside of office hours


**Skills And Competencies**
* Proven experience in a similar role (SRE, DevOps, or Systems Engineer) managing Linux-based systems and applications
* Experience in managing an AWS environment, including automation
* Hands-on experience in automation and scripting for infrastructure, containers, systems, and applications
* Understanding of the challenges and responsibilities of running a 24/7 operation
* Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment
* Enthusiasm for troubleshooting and using issues as opportunities to learn and improve
* Fluent written and spoken English


 Technical Environment - We have a broad toolset in use; any level of working knowledge with one or more of these tools or technologies is a plus:
   

  

* Linux
* Kubernetes/Rancher/Docker
* Jenkins/Rundeck
* Tomcat
* PostgreSQL/MySQL/SQL Server
* Splunk
* RabbitMQ
* ElasticSearch


 Bonus points
   

  

* Extensive in-depth experience in any of the tools/technologies mentioned above


**Who You Are**
* Well-organized and have a positive, solution-focused attitude
* Analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills
* A collaborative team player with great communication skills
* Committed to maintaining reliable, high-performance systems that serve our customers globally
* Please submit your CV in English\*


 At nShift, we believe in embracing diversity in all forms and fostering an inclusive environment for everyone, which we believe is essential for our continued success. We're an equal opportunity employer, meaning all applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity, or disability status.

title: Senior Data Management Specialist to Data & Analytics team within Cash Management, CIB | SEB, Stockholm
description:
**About The Role**
 In this role, you will be part of the team responsible for managing and developing SEB’s Account & Payments data. You will take an active role in shaping how data is modelled, governed, and maintained — ensuring high data quality and compliance across our products and systems.
   

  

 You’ll work closely with data owners, stewards, architects, analysts, and business stakeholders to ensure that our data is structured, understood, and usable for everything from regulatory reporting to customer insights and product innovation.
   

  

 Our data and analytics solutions are built on
 **Google Cloud Platform (GCP)** 
 .
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Take ownership of the Account & Payments data domain and drive initiatives related to data modelling, governance, and quality.
* Define, document, and maintain conceptual and logical data models that describe our financial products and processes, using EA Sparx.
* Support implementation of data management practices, including metadata management, business glossaries, and data lineage.
* Coordinate across teams to ensure alignment between business, data, and technical perspectives.
* Drive continuous improvement of our data governance and data quality processes in collaboration with the central data office.
* Contribute to SEB’s data strategy by identifying opportunities to improve data reusability, consistency, and compliance.
* Communicate and translate complex data concepts to business stakeholders in a clear and engaging way.


**Who We Are Looking For**
 We are looking for a senior professional with strong experience in
 **data management within banking or financial services** 
 . You enjoy both coordinating across stakeholders and diving deep into the details when needed.
   

  

 You may have held roles such as Data Management Officer, Data Steward, Information Modeler, Data Owner, or Information Architect — what matters most is your broad understanding of data management and your ability to turn knowledge into action.
   

  

**Your Background And Skills**
* 5–8 years of experience within data management, preferably in the banking sector.
* Solid understanding of data modelling (conceptual, logical), data governance, and data quality management.
* Experience working with information models, metadata, or business glossaries.
* Familiarity with modelling tools and cloud-based data platforms such as GCP.
* Ability to navigate regulatory and compliance aspects related to data.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, combined with excellent communication abilities.
* Fluent in English; Swedish is a plus.


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 7 January 2026. If you have questions about the position, please contact Jonatan Elnäs at jonatan.elnas@seb.se. We will not process applications via email.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for instance identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, which is why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.

title: Enterprise Hackathon Director
description:
**The Role**
 Lovable is looking for an
 **Enterprise Hackathons Lead** 
 — a creative, operational, and relationship-driven builder who can design and run high-impact hackathons that turn prospects into customers, and customers into power users.
   

  

 You’ll own the end-to-end motion of
 **Enterprise Hackathons and AI Activation Programs** 
 — from pre-sales events with perspective customers to onboarding and enablement experiences for our largest Enterprise customers.
   

  

**Your mission:**
 Turn hackathons into our most powerful growth and adoption engine.
   

  

 Every event you run should move pipeline, drive product usage, and deepen our enterprise partnerships.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Design & Execute Enterprise Hackathons Plan and deliver world-class hackathons for enterprise prospects and customers — from agenda design and challenge framing to on-site execution and post-event storytelling.
* Build Repeatable Playbooks Create scalable frameworks and templates for different hackathon types (pre-sales, onboarding, internal innovation, partner events).
* Partner with Marketing & Field Teams Collaborate on event strategy, branding, and community activations to turn hackathons into flagship moments for Lovable.
* Accelerate Deals & Adoption Work with Sales and CS to tie each hackathon to measurable outcomes — product usage, time-to-value, deal expansion, or pilot conversion.
* Enable the Organization Train internal teams (CSMs, AEs, Engineers) on running their own lightweight activations using your playbooks.
* Capture and Amplify Wins Turn each hackathon into content — stories, case studies, and learnings that fuel Lovable’s narrative on how the world builds with AI.


**Who You Are**
* You’re a builder at heart — creative, scrappy, and comfortable in front of customers.
* You’ve run or produced hackathons, innovation labs, or technical workshops (at an enterprise, accelerator, or tech company).
* You have experience in Customer Success, GTM Programs, Developer Relations, or Field Marketing.
* You’re fluent in both business outcomes and technical storytelling — you can connect design systems and AI workflows to enterprise value.
* You thrive in cross-functional environments — you know how to align Product, Marketing, and Sales to make magic happen.
* You’re energized by fast-paced, high-visibility projects that blend creativity and execution.


**Success Looks Like:**
* Lovable hackathons become the #1 driver of enterprise adoption and expansion.
* Every hackathon has a clear business outcome (pipeline acceleration, product usage uplift, expansion).
* Internal teams adopt your playbooks and frameworks, making hackathons repeatable and scalable.
* Lovable becomes known for running the best AI hackathons in the industry — the events everyone wants to attend.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**About the Role** 




  





 As a Data Engineer, you take a central role in developing our data platform and creating smart solutions that make it easier to make decisions, follow up on the business, and build the data- and AI-driven processes of the future.
 



  





 You’ll work across the entire chain – from designing data pipelines and modelling in the cloud to visualizing insights in Power BI. You’ll help define how we work with data and enjoy experimenting with new technologies to make our solutions even smarter.
 



  





**We Believe You:** 




  




* Hold a degree in information systems, computer science, or have equivalent experience
* Currently based in Sweden
* Have 1–3 years of experience in BI, data engineering, or data analytics
* Are proficient in SQL and data modelling
* Have built ETL/ELT flows and worked with BI visualization
* Are curious about AI, ML, automation, and combining data with intelligent agents
* Enjoy taking responsibility, work independently, and collaborate closely with the business while exploring new ways to solve problems



  





**Extra Merits:** 




  




* Experience with CI/CD pipelines in Azure DevOps
* Snowflake and DBT
* Data classification
* Python or similar languages
* API design and integrations
* Experience from the financial sector or regulatory reporting
* Databricks, AI/ML workflows, or agent-based systems

title: Data Engineer
description:
**📊 Data & Analytics Engineer - Stockholm (Hybrid)** 




  





*Shape the future of data-driven decision-making in a modernising enterprise* 




  





 A well-established Swedish company is undergoing a major digital transformation and is looking for a
 **Data & Analytics Engineer** 
 to help build and optimise its new cloud-based data platform. This is a unique opportunity to join a small, high-impact team at the early stages of a long-term data modernisation journey.
 



  





 You’ll work across the full data lifecycle - from ingestion and modelling to orchestration and reporting - using modern tools like DBT, Power BI, and Azure Data Factory. The role blends elements of analytics engineering, BI development, and data pipeline optimisation, offering broad exposure and real ownership.
 



  





 🧠 What You’ll Do
 


* Own and evolve the company’s DBT-based data models, supporting business-critical reporting and analytics
* Build and maintain Power BI dashboards that deliver actionable insights to stakeholders
* Collaborate with business users to understand data needs and translate them into scalable models
* Orchestrate and monitor data pipelines using Azure Data Factory
* Optimise Snowflake usage and cost, and contribute to performance tuning
* Support legacy SQL Server-based data flows and help plan their gradual migration to the cloud
* Work closely with a small team to shape the company’s modern BI architecture



  





 🛠 Tech Stack
 


* **Core** 
 : SQL, DBT, Power BI, Snowflake
* **Cloud & Orchestration** 
 : Azure, Azure Data Factory, Blob Storage
* **Other** 
 : Python (for light scripting), Git, Medallion architecture (Bronze/Silver/Gold)



  





 🎯 What We’re Looking For
 


* Strong SQL skills and experience with data modelling and transformation
* Familiarity with DBT or a strong interest in learning it
* Experience building reports in Power BI or similar tools
* Understanding of data orchestration and pipeline monitoring (e.g., ADF, Airflow)
* Ability to work across both backend and frontend data layers
* Interest in staying up to date with new features and best practices in the data ecosystem
* Swedish language proficiency is required due to stakeholder interaction and on-call responsibilities



  





 💼 Role Details
 


* **Location** 
 : Sollentuna, Stockholm (50/50 hybrid)
* **Benefits** 
 : Competitive salary, Union agreement, pension, wellness allowance, and more
* **Team** 
 : You’ll work alongside a small but growing data team, with lots of room to shape processes and tooling



  





 🚀 Why This Role?
 


* Join a company at the start of a major cloud and data transformation
* Work with modern tools and architectures in a greenfield environment
* Take ownership of key systems and influence long-term strategy
* Be part of a stable, profitable business with a strong customer base and ambitious tech leadership

title: Security Solution Engineer
description:
**Overview**
 Are you insatiably curious and do you lean into uncertainty, take risks, and learn quickly from? Are you passionate about cybersecurity? Do you enjoy working on a high-performing, fast-paced sales team? Are you insatiably curious and do you lean into uncertainty, take risks, and learn quickly from your mistakes? Are you ready to join the team that is at the leading edge of innovation at Microsoft?  If so, we are looking for you!
   

  

 The Microsoft Security organization’s mission of making the world a safer place has never been more important. As threats become more frequent and sophisticated, we must work to keep our customers safe through our Security Solutions. The Solution Specialist Unit team within the Microsoft Security organization is at the forefront of this effort, engaging directly with customers to contribute to their success. As the largest security company in the world, we are ideally placed to think outside the box to help our customers make the world a safer place.
   

  

 As a Security Solution Engineer you will be a senior technical sales leader and trusted customer advisor, working with cutting-edge security technologies such as Microsoft Defender for XDR and Sentinel. You will lead a v-team of other internal, partner and consulting resources to help map Microsoft solutions to customer security challenges and priorities, demonstrate and prove our solutions, and win the technical decision enabling the team to achieve/exceed quarterly and annual revenue targets. You will help solve complex security challenges for our customers, enabling them to help modernize their security architecture and posture.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Primary technical point of contact for potential customers during the sales process, owing and driving technical win for security opportunities
* Deep technical understanding of cloud security architectures, solutions/technologies including Microsoft M365 Defender, Defender for cloud and Sentinel and expertise in extended detection and response (XDR), zero trust and cloud security solutions and architectures
* Remediate blockers; leads and ensures technical wins for Microsoft Security and adjacent technologies. Engages with and reaches out to customers proactively and independently; builds credibility with customers as a trusted advisor for Microsoft Security; and searches for and uses Microsoft Security customer references; and facilitates handoff to customer success for post sales deployment.
* Develop strategies and recommendations to improve the client's security posture, shapes technical win plan and tailors Microsoft messaging to audience for security opportunities. Enhances team capabilities for extended detection and response (XDR), zero trust and cloud security and develops differentiated compete strategies for Microsoft Security for assigned customers.
* Lead technical presentations, demonstrations, workshops, architecture design sessions, explain, demonstrate, and architect the solution to help solve customer security challenges and priorities.
* Drives cross-workload support for Microsoft solutions for security. Leverages insights and coaches' teams to align new or changing technology to customer security needs.
* Responsible for engaging with other teams within and outside the organization throughout the sales cycle. Engaging partners in sell-with scenarios and supporting their technical capabilities is key to scaling solution delivery.


**Qualifications**
* Proven years of technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience
+ OR Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field AND A few years technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience
+ OR Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field AND a couple years technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience
+ OR equivalent experience

* Experience with SIEM-systems (either Sentinel or others)
* Swedish (preferred) and English (fluent)


 This position will be open for a minimum of 5 days, with applications accepted on an ongoing basis until the position is filled.
   

  

 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance with religious accommodations and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about
 **requesting accommodations.**

title: Data Engineer / Data Governance Engineer
description:
